results.title: Not really morning people
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Renee Rutgrink
results.brief_description: Can’t handle Mondays? Don’t think you can get out of bed tomorrow? Perhaps you’re not really a morning person. A cheeky tour into our morning journeys guided by a couple of observant experts we never really notice.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Renee Rutgrink

results.title: Not ready
results.creator_credit: Linh Nguyen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: While Linh Nguyen is on the cusp of adulthood and taking the next step in her life, she reflects on a simpler, more carefree time and hopes for a time where she will gain greater clarity and certainty.

results.title: Not quite Jerusalem
results.brief_description: Set in a kibbutz, Joanne Pacula and Sam Robards are cast as an Isreali girl and an American volunteer, who meet and fall in love on the kibbutz. Gila (Pacula) is a hardnosed and foulmouthed “kibbutz-nik” who tones down her language when she finds love. Cast includes Kevin McNally, Todd Graff and Selina Cadell.

results.title: Not only to save our jobs
results.brief_description: Shows how a group of people at a small Melbourne manufacturing company acted to overcome the threat of losing their jobs by setting up a new form of organisation based on worker participation in ownership and decision-making. The effects on employees’ attitudes and work relationships are shown.
results.description: Shows how a group of people at a small Melbourne manufacturing company acted to overcome the threat of losing their jobs by setting up a new form of organisation based on worker participation in ownership and decision-making. results.title: Not one less = Yi ge dou bu neng shao
results.creator_credit: Zhang Yimou, Zhao Yu, Guangxi Film Studio and Beijing New Picture Film Company
results.brief_description: Directed by Yimou Zhang, the rural drama “Not one less” is a study in poverty and the determination of one teenage girl. Wei Minzhi is a barely educated thirteen-year-old, who takes on a job teaching young children at an impoverished village school. As the regular teacher leaves he promises Wei bonus pay if, upon his return, all the students are still in school. Inexperienced and overwhelmed, but relentlessly stubborn, Wei faces ingratitude and her own misery as she grapples with the recalcitrant students. When one boy is sent to work in the city, where he lives on the street, Wei pursues him. Once there Wei is overwhelmed by the crowds, bustling street life and enormity of the task of finding a young boy amid the vast city and innumerable homeless children who reside there. Here Zhang steers away from the lush melodramas, such as “Raise the red lantern”, “Red sorghum” and “Shanghai Triad”, in favour of a sparse aesthetic that speaks of the plight of rural Chinese, portraying village life decimated by the commercialisation of China.
results.title_for_label: Not one less = Yi ge dou bu neng shao
results.creator_credit_for_label: Zhang Yimou, Zhao Yu, Guangxi Film Studio and Beijing New Picture Film Company

results.title: Not my problem
results.creator_credit: Ann Vracin, Dan Bessie and Barr Films
results.brief_description: Dave is the usual gregarious 16 year-old. Baseball, homework and Susan, his current love, take most of his time. But when Susan suspects she is pregnant, Dave won’t alter his schedule to discuss the problem. As he tells his friends, “If she does get herself pregnant, it’s not my problem.” Only Jim, one of Dave’s friends, tries to convince him that it is his problem…and his and Susan’s. When Susan comes to the baseball field to talk with Dave, the reality of the situation suddenly becomes clear. They have some very important decisions to make…together.

results.title: Not just your average sausage
results.creator_credit: Denis Harvey, Martin Didsbury and Television One (New Zealand)
results.brief_description: Provides a description of the manufacture of salami from its source to the consumer. Highlights the role of the European tradition to the high level of skills required in the processing of salami.

results.title: Not just me
results.brief_description:
Using double takes and mirror image photography, this rather clever and amusing piece captures a day in the life of a guy who keeps on multiplying. No dialogue. Natural background sound.
Graduate work from RMIT media arts (BA Arts)

results.title: Not just a spectator
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description: It is a mistake to think that physically disabled people cannot play sport. They can actively compete in many sports and recreational activities, and greatly benefit from the special classes geared to their needs. Shows how the trained instructors, helpers and general public can help and encourage them.
